DataElement.preferredName: Short Physical Performance Battery 23 Shorter of Two Times for Gait Speed Test Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number value in seconds of the shorter of the two times for the gait speed test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 Functional Test Shorter of Two Times for Gait Speed Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Short Physical Performance Battery V1.2 (SPPB V1.2) (Guralnik JM, Ferrucci L, Pieper CF, Leveille SG, Markides KS, Ostir GV, Studenski S, Berkman LF, Wallace RB. Lower extremity function and subsequent disability: consistency across studies, predictive models, and value of gait speed alone compared with the short physical performance battery. J Gerontol A Biol Sci Med Sci 2000 April;55(4):M221-M231)._A request for the shorter time of the two gait speed tests completed by an individual.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 Functional Test
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Short Physical Performance Battery V1.2 (SPPB V1.2) (Guralnik JM, Ferrucci L, Pieper CF, Leveille SG, Markides KS, Ostir GV, Studenski S, Berkman LF, Wallace RB. Lower extremity function and subsequent disability: consistency across studies, predictive models, and value of gait speed alone compared with the short physical performance battery. J Gerontol A Biol Sci Med Sci 2000 April;55(4):M221-M231).

Concepts.longName: Short Physical Performance Battery Version 1.2 Functional Test
Concepts.definition: A standardized five-item 10-minute assessment tool, developed by Guralnik et al. 1994, that is used for the evaluation of lower extremity physical function and consists of three subtests, including standing balance, walking, and rising from a chair.

Property.preferredName: Shorter of Two Times for Gait Speed Test
Property.preferredDefinition: A request for the shorter time of the two gait speed tests completed by an individual.

Concepts.longName: Shorter of Two Times for Gait Speed Test
Concepts.definition: A request for the shorter time of the two gait speed tests completed by an individual.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR per E. Lyalka for protocol 000359 - smt

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value with no fractional part to represent a value of seconds._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
